name: Charity Checkout
slogan: Online fundraising all under your own brand
description:
Our Purpose:
We strengthen relationships between charities and their supporters. Every day hundreds of thousands of people get together to do brilliant things for good causes. Whether they are running a charity, a cake stall or a half marathon, they’re doing something to make our world a bit better and we believe that should be celebrated. Every charity needs to connect personally with their supporters and make every relationship count. Nothing should ever get between your charity and your supporters.

The Product:
Charity Checkout provides branded and personalised online fundraising products. Our award-winning tech helps charities engage their supporters directly on their own fundraising platform, putting them in control of their online fundraising, data and supporter relationships. Removing the need for complex payments tech, merchant accounts, website developers and fiddly Gift Aid admin, we offer an easier way for charities to accept online donations directly under their own brand.

jobs.title: Business Development Associate
jobs.description:
About us:
Charity Checkout is a tech startup with a difference. At Charity Checkout we are on a mission to support good causes and to help them grow. We are revolutionising the way that charities and corporations approach online fundraising by leading the way in the development of fundraising technology. Our new and innovative fundraising tech is changing online fundraising for the better and is already trusted by over 3,000 charities and corporations across the UK. Due to our continued rapid growth, we are expanding and are looking for a Business Development Associate to join our team.

The focus of the role is:
To sell our innovative fundraising software to a variety of charities across the UK. The sales process will involve strategically prospecting and sourcing your own leads, conducting online demos and closing new business. 
You will be given full market, product and sales training in order to start building your sales career. 
The role will also require you to: 
Develop and manage executive level relationships with charities across the UK
Maintain a clear understanding of the charity sector while effectively adapting to changing dynamics
Work directly with Head of Sales and Senior Partnerships Managers in order to create the best proposition for our customers

We are looking for the following:
A Bachelor’s Degree or experience in a sales environment
Self-motivation
Ambition
Resilience 
Emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
The ability to demonstrate your potential for a career in sales

Benefits:
Help make a positive difference to charities
Be part of a real growth story
Equity options scheme
Generous pay
22 days holiday plus 3 day Christmas closure & bank holidays (33 in total)
Holiday buy-back each year for up to 5 unused days
Birthday break, two hours back (to have a lie in, long lunch or leave early)
One paid day to fundraise for a charity of your choice
Perks:
Flexible holiday allowance
Flexible start and finish times
Early Friday finish for team drinks
Monthly team lunch
Team activities
Cycle to work scheme
Season ticket loan
PS4 with FIFA 20 - be ready to compete with our highly competitive FIFA players !

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
We have just hired a new Marketing Director and are establishing a turbocharged marketing team! We have a huge story to tell, just made our first company acquisition and due to our continued rapid growth, we are looking for a Digital Marketing Manager to help the company fly!

The focus of the role is:

This is a pivotal hire for us. You’ll be our first Digital Marketing Manager, joining a new marketing team in our fast-growing business. The main objectives of the role will be: 

●	Drive the digital marketing strategy for the business at a time when it is rebranding and experiencing rapid growth

●	Ensure our digital strategy is consistent across all channels, that we have one tone of voice and that our activations are on-brand  

●	Work with our growth freelancer and graphic designer to optimise our site for performance and ensuring it gives the best customer experience for our diverse audiences 

●	Iterate the site content and CTAs based on analytics and performance 

●	Work closely with sales and marketing leaders in order to drive successful lead generation and lead nurturing programmes and deliver MQLs to the sales team using our CRM platform 

●	Manage, iterate and test all digital paid ad campaigns to drive ROI for the company including PPC and paid social campaigns (pairing closely with our Content and PR manager to sync our paid, owned and earned activations) 

●	Constantly review and report on the performance of campaigns and the website 

●	Work with the Customer Success team to drive success on reviews sites e.g. Trustpilot

●	Work with our PR and Content Manager to establish content across our site and on 3rd party sites to drive positive SEO rankings. Pair with them to create content which drives engagement at each point in the purchase funnel. 

●	Edit hero content to create multiple snackable pieces of content - video, gifs, social posts - to drive engagement 

●	Partner with our commercial team to investigate and launch successful affiliate partnerships  

We are looking for the following:

●	Experience working at a B2B SaaS technology provider 

●	Experience of setting up digital marketing campaigns from scratch 

●	Track record of delivering measurable results 

●	Experience of managing website projects with knowledge of HTML/JavaScript and SEO 

●	A collaborator who enjoys working as part of a broader team to drive results 

●	Positive attitude, a problem solver 

●	An innovator who keeps abreast of the latest advancements in digital

●	An insights led expert who understands how to drive behaviour which positively impacts purchasing behaviour  

●	Excellent written communication and attention to detail

●	Ability to work autonomously and prioritise conflicting workloads from multiple stakeholders 

●	Flexible, adaptable and resilient attitude

●	Have an eye for what content flies on social media. Have the ability to write compelling mico copy and stay on brand 

●	Ability to interact confidently, build relationships quickly and establish credibility

We’d love it if:

●	You have a thorough understanding of both brand building and direct response 

Benefits of the role include:
* Help make a positive difference to charities
* Be part of a real growth story
* Equity options scheme
* Generous pay
* 22 days holiday plus 3 day Christmas closure & bank holidays (33 in total)
* Holiday buy-back each year for up to 5 unused days
* Birthday break, two hours back (to have a lie in, long lunch or leave early)
* One paid day to fundraise for a charity of your choice

Perks:
* Flexible holiday allowance
* Flexible start and finish times
* Early Friday finish for team drinks
* Monthly team lunch
* Team activity days
* Cycle to work scheme
* Season ticket loan
* PS4 with FIFA 20 - be ready to compete with our highly competitive FIFA players !

jobs.title: PR & Content Manager
jobs.description:
About us:
CharityCheckout is a B2B SaaS company with a difference. Our products bring good causes closer to their supporters, putting them in control of their online fundraising. We are revolutionising the way that charities raise funds online, by leading the way in the development of fundraising technology. Our new and innovative fundraising tech is changing the charity sector for the better and is already trusted by over 4,000 good causes across the UK. 
We have just hired a new Marketing Director and are establishing a turbocharged marketing team! We have a huge story to tell, just made our first company acquisition and due to our continued rapid growth, we are looking for a PR & Content Manager to help the company fly!

The focus of the role is:
This is a pivotal hire for us. You’ll be our first PR & Content Manager, joining a new marketing team in our fast-growing business. The main objectives of the role will be:  
Driving the content marketing agenda and establishing thought leadership campaigns. Writing, editing, curating and distributing our content
Making us famous through a PR strategy which lands coverage in the national and trade press. Pitching proactive stories directly to journalists and working with them to develop exclusive bylines 
Working closely with sales and marketing leaders in order to develop a content strategy and developing creative ideas for lead generation campaigns
Taking charge of thought leadership content with cutting-edge research about consumer behaviour and attitudes and challenges in the charity sector 
Implementing an internal comms strategy by identifying the best methods of communicating to, engaging with, and gaining insight from our audiences
Ensuring consistency of messaging across all communications
Championing strategic messages, values and behaviours and support embedding them across CharityCheckout
Training spokespeople to speak to journalists and convey key company messages 
Work closely with the Marketing Director on establishing a crisis comms process 

We are looking for the following:
Experience across communications and content strategy
Excellent written communication and attention to detail
Proven record of driving press coverage in trade and national titles. A nose for a good story driven by data and insights  
Experience producing thought leadership content
Ability to work autonomously and prioritise work
Flexible, adaptable and resilient attitude
Able to work calmly under pressure
History of using lead gen and content management platforms 
Have an eye for what content flies on social media. Have the ability to write compelling mico copy  
Ability to interact confidently, build relationships quickly and establish credibility

We’d love it if:
You have experience working at a B2B SaaS technology provider in the charity sector 
You have experience across the entire content marketing spectrum - from PR and thought leadership through to lead conversion and product marketing

Benefits:
Help make a positive difference to charities
Be part of a real growth story
Equity options scheme
Generous pay
22 days holiday plus 3 day Christmas closure & bank holidays (33 in total)
Holiday buy-back each year for up to 5 unused days
Birthday break, two hours back (to have a lie in, long lunch or leave early)
One paid day to fundraise for a charity of your choice
Perks:
Flexible holiday allowance
Flexible start and finish times
Early Friday finish for team drinks
Monthly team lunch
Team activities
